data.title: Colorado Parks & Wildlife
data.meta_description: Colorado Parks and Wildlife is a nationally recognized leader in conservation, outdoor recreation and wildlife management. The agency​ manages 42 state parks, all of Colorado's wildlife, more than 300 state wildlife areas and a host of recreational programs. CPW issues hunting and fishing licenses, conducts research to improve wildlife management activities, protects high priority wildlife habitat through acquisitions and partnerships, provides technical assistance to private and other public landowners concerning wildlife and habitat management and develops programs to understand, protect and recover threatened and endangered species.
data.text:
Park Entrance Pass Information

Page Content

​​​​​​​​​​

​​​

All Colorado State Parks have entrance fees. All vehicles are required to have an entrance pass and some parks have walk-in fees.

​​​

​Which Parks Pass is right for you?

Click on the park pass name to learn about purchasing requirements and options (including replacing lost or damaged passes).

Daily Passes

Daily Vehicle Pass - $10 per vehicle

Tow Vehicle Pass - No fee for vehicle under-tow at time of entry. Motorhome still requires a paid park pass.

Annual Passes

Annual Affixed Vehicle Pass - $80 per vehicle. A Vehicle Annual Pass can be purchased at any time of year and is valid for a full 12 months of use. The pass is good through the last day of the month, one year from purchase. Purchase it online today!

Keep Colorado Wild Pass​ (Colorado ​Residents Only) - $29 Keep Colorado Wild Pass is added to annual vehicle registration through the Division of Motor Vehicles (DMV). The $29 pass fee is included automatically unless you choose to opt out. This new annual pass gives all Coloradans access to state parks and the added benefit of supporting our great outdoors and wildlife in a meaningful way.​

Family Annual Pass​ - $120 per pass. These passes are associated with an individual purchaser's address instead of a vehicle. The Family Annual pass can be moved between vehicles as long as any resident of the address associated with the pass is present.

Annual Affixed Vehicle Multiple Pass - $40 per vehicle. After purchase of an Annual Vehicle or Family Pass, vehicles in the same household are eligible for a discounted multiple pass.​ Valid dates for the multiple are the same as the Annual or Family pass originally purchased.

Aspen Leaf Pass - $70 per vehicle (CO Residents 64 years or older). The Aspen Leaf pass is available for purchase at any time of year and is valid for 12 months from date of purchase.

Aspen Leaf Multiple Pass​ - $35 per vehicle. After purchase of an Aspen Annual Pass, the senior must be in whole or part owner of additional vehicles to be eligible for a discounted multiple pass. Valid dates for the multiple are the same as the Aspen Leaf pass originally purchased.​

​Specialty Passes and Plates​

Non-motor Vehicle Individual Passes - Both Individual Pass types below are required for anyone entering a state park by foot, bicycle, horseback, etc. except at Boyd Lake, Chatfield, Cherry Creek, Cheyenne Mountain and Lake Pueblo.

Non-motor Vehicle Individua​l Daily Pass - $4 per day.

Park visitors 16 yrs or older must carry a current Individual Daily pass (physical or digital app) or use the upper panels of their annual pass to enter the park. Daily pass entry expires at noon the following day.

Non-motor Vehicle Indiv​id​ual Annual Pass - $29​ per year.

Park visitors 16 yrs or older, must carry a current Individual Annual pass (physical or digital app) or use the upper panels of their annual pass to enter the park. The annual pass also allows up to three additional park visitors to enter the park with the current pass holder.

Dog Off-Leash Area Pass (Cherry Creek and Chatfield only) - $25 annual or $3 per day

Columbine Pass - $14 (Disabled CO Residents only)

Colorado Disabled Veterans License Plate - no cost. See our Military Benefits page for more information.

Independence Pass - no cost (Disabled CO Resident veterans only). See our Military Benefits page for more information.

Centennial Pass - $14 (Income Eligible CO Residents only)

Blue Spruce Pass - Free (Disabled First Responder CO Residents only)

August ​Military Pass​ - no cost. For more information, see the Military Benefits​ page.​​​

*In addition to the cost listed above, for entrance to Cherry Creek State Park, an annual $3 or $1 per day ​water basin authority pass is also required.

​Where can you purchase your park pass?

Annual park passes can be purchased onl​ine​​​

​All state parks and Colorado Parks and​ Wildlife Offices​

Any authorized sales agent​

Specialty passes must be applied for at a CPW location​

How to Attach Your Affixed Park Pass to Your Vehicle

​​Annual Vehicle and Aspen Leaf Passes

​

All annual vehicle passes (except the Family Annual) must be permanently affixed to the customer's vehicle. Customers who purchase a Vehicle Annual or Aspen Leaf Pass will be provided a plastic ​sticker to affix their pass to their vehicle.​

​​​​​​How to Display Specialty Hang Tag Passes in Your Vehicle​

​Since these passes are associated to an individual, not a vehicle, they may be moved from car-to-car as long as the passholder is present.

(Note: The passholder must be present with these passes, unlike the Family Annual Pass process described above)

Customers who purchase a Centennial, Col​umbine, Independence, Blue Spruce or August Military pass will be provided a reusable hang tag to display their pass.​​ The pass can be secured in the hang tag by tucking the corners into the corner slits. For increased stability, it is recommended that passes be taped to the hang tag. ​​​​If you are mailed your pass without a hangtag, the hangtag can be picked up free of charge at CPW offices or state park offices.

​

​Discounts for buying in large quantities

​Annual vehicle and family passes that are purchased in large quantities (at least 20) during a single sales transaction at a CPW location may receive the following discounts:

If you purchase 20-49 passes = 20% discount

If you purchase 50-99 passes = 25% discount

If you purchase 100+ passes = 30% discount

*Aspen Leaf Passes are not available for bulk order d​​iscounts.

Redeeming Bulk Pass Vouchers

Customers can redeem a bulk pass voucher for their actual park pass at any CPW location or State Park. Vouchers CANNOT be redeemed online.

Customers wishing to get the quantity discount should contact their local CPW office or park​ for additional information.
